content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution written in Julia programming language using DataFrames.jl package. First, you need to install it if not installed yet with `Pkg.add("DataFrames")` command. 

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [format(x, "yyyyMM") for x in df[:dt]]
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and creates a new column `:ym` by extracting year and month from the `:dt` column using the format function which converts DateTime to string with specified format. The `"yyyyMM"` specifies that we want the year in 4 digits, followed by month in 2 digits.

Note: This solution assumes that your `df[:dt]` column is of type DateTime. If it isn't you need to convert it first using `convert(DateTime, df[:dt])`.
